{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Firetide |model=1000S |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=03/01/2004 |manuf_country= |manuf=Soekris Engineering |manuf_model=net4501 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=mesh node |fcc_id=REP-1000S-1 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner=2.5 |pwr_barrel_outer=5.2 |pwr_barrel_len=11 |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=AMD |cpu1_model=ElanSC520-133AC |cpu1_cspeed=133 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=SanDisk |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_model=MT48LC16M16A2-75-D |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI,PCI,CompactFlash |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num=1 |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=DE-9 |wi1_module=Senao NL-2511MP PLUS |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip1_model=ISL3874 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=ISL3685 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL,RP-TNC |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=National Semiconductor |eth_chip1_model=DP83815 |eth_chip2_brand=National Semiconductor |eth_chip2_model=DP83815 |eth_chip3_brand=National Semiconductor |eth_chip3_model=DP83815 |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=3 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid=firetide |default_ssid_regex=^firetide$ |default_ip=192.168.224.100 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=00:02:6F |oui_eth=00:00:24 |default_ch= }} ''HotPoint Wireless Mesh Router''
The device is a Soekris net4501 board with a Senao wireless module and a CompactFlash card (appears to be 128MB). :The stock OS appears to be FreeBSD.
Default settings in this entry (as well as the Ethernet IF OUI) are per the CF card recovered from the pictured (broken) unit..
The included power adapter is a '''Jameco''' DDU120100, P/N DC1210F1 (12VDC, 1000mA). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate.
